plot.content:
This is a continuation of the idea behind the "Sand" series.

Plotted on A3 watercolor paper using fountain pens (Turquoise and Amber). The two ink are blending into different shade of greens.

The 100000 small strokes were plotted for 12 hours!

The art piece will be put on auction and 100% will be given to https://github.com/teia-community/teia-docs/wiki/Ukranian-Fundraising.

data.title: Sand of hope
data.description: This is a continuation of the idea behind the Sand series. Plotted on A3 watercolor paper using fountain pens (Turquoise and Amber). The two ink are blending into different shade of greens. The 100000 small strokes were plotted for 12 hours!

prev.content: A new experiment that consists of transitioning between two curves over repetition on Y.

next.content:
This plot explores 4 stripes of Amber and Turquoise inks displaced using domain warping technique of various perlin noises. A volcano shape emerge on the center of the piece.

The art piece will be put on auction and 100% will be given to https://github.com/teia-community/teia-docs/wiki/Ukranian-Fundraising.

Done during a live stream on https://twitch.tv/greweb

data.title: Volcano of hope
data.description: This plot explores 4 stripes of Amber and Turquoise inks displaced using domain warping technique of various perlin noises. A volcano shape emerge on the center of the piece.
